intro: Chiococca pubescens, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvet tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
